tuv.seg: A barrister (also called "counsel") is a type of lawyer who specialises in court advocacy and the giving of legal opinion
Cineál dlíodóra is ea abhcóide ar speisialtóir é in abhcóideacht chúirte agus i gcomhairle dlíthiúil
To become a barrister, you must pass the exams set by the Kings Inns
Ní mór do abhcóidí bónaí bána agus róba dubh a chaitheamh i bhformhór na gcúirteanna
(The Kings Inns is the body which governs entry to the profession of barrister-at-law in Ireland)
Ní mór dóibh peiriúic a chaitheamh chomh maith
After you have passed your exams, you must be "called to the Bar" and you must complete a year of "devilling", which is a form of apprenticeship for barristers
I gcúirteanna áirithe, mar shampla a i gcúirteanna dlí teaghlaigh, ní chaitheann abhcóidí peiriúic nó róbaí
Barristers must wear white collars and a black gown in most courts. They may also wear a wig
In Éirinn ní ligtear do abhcóidí seomraí nó comhpháirtíochtaí a bhunú
In certain courts, such as the family law courts and the children's court, barristers do not wear the wig and gown
Tá gach abhcóide féin-fhostaithe agus oibríonn sé mar dhuine aonair
Barristers are not allowed to set up "chambers" or partnerships together
Ní cheadaítear d’abhcóidí “dlísheomraí” nó comhpháirtíochtaí a bhunú le chéile
Each barrister is self-employed and works as an individual
Tá gach abhcóide féinfhostaithe agus oibríonn sé/sí mar dhuine aonair

In December 2015, the Oireachtas passed the Legal Services Regulation Act 2015 which provides for, among other things, new business models for legal practitioners including barrister/barrister and barrister/solicitor partnerships and multi-disciplinary practices

I Nollaig 2015, rith an tOireachtas an tAcht um Rialáil Seirbhísí Dlí, 2015 a fhorálann, i measc rudaí eile, do shamhlacha nua gnó do chleachtóirí dlí, ina measc comhpháirtíochtaí abhcóide/abhcóide agus abhcóide/aturnae agus cleachtais ildisciplíneacha
If you are involved in a court case, you may come across junior and senior counsel
Má tá tú páirteach i gcás dlí d'fhéadfá bualach le abhcóidí sóisir agus sinsir
Barristers have a wide range of different functions:
Tá réimse leathan feidhmeanna an ag abhcóidí:
• Barristers draft legal opinions
• Dréachtaíonn abhcóidí comhairle dhlíthiúil
For example, a barrister might give you a legal opinion on whether or not you have a good legal case against someone with whom you have had a dispute
Mar shampla, d'fhéadfadh abhcóide comhairle dhlíthiúil a thabhairt duit faoi cibé and bhfuil nó nach bhfuil cás maith agat i gcoinne duine a bhfuil díospóid agat leis
• The barrister will then write the legal documents (writs or pleadings) which must be filed in the case
• Déanfaidh an abhcóide ansin na doiciméid dhlithiúla a scríobh (eascairí nó pleadálacha) a chaithfear a chomhdú sa chás
• When the case comes to trial, it is the barrister who will represent you in court, speak on your behalf and argue your case before the judge
• Nuair a thagann an cás chun trialach is é an abhcóide a fheidhmeoidh agus a labhróidh ar do shon, agus a chuirfidh do cás faoi bhráid an bhreithimh
• Your barrister may also be the person who negotiates a settlement of your case instead of it going to trial
• D'fhéadfadh do abhcóide socraíocht do cháis a idirbheartú in ionad ligean dó a dhul chun trialach
Barristers are not contacted directly by the public - they are engaged by solicitors to work on a case
Ní féidir teagmháil a dhéanamh go díreach le abhcóide - déanann aturnaetha iad a fhostú chun obair ar chás
When you contact a solicitor for legal advice, your solicitor may recommend that a barrister be engaged to provide services
Nuair a theann tú i dteagmháil le aturnae ag lorg comhairle dlithiúla, d'fhéadfadh do aturnae moladh duit go ndéanfaí abhcóide a fhostú chun seirbhísí a sholáthar

If you and your solicitor decide to involve a barrister in your case, the solicitor will send the barrister a brief containing all the relevant information and documents to assist the barrister in the presentation of the case

Má shocraíonn tú agus do aturnae ar abhcóide a úsáid i do chás, cuirfidh an aturnae mionteagasc chuig an abhcóide leis an eolas ábhartha agus na doiciméid uilig chun cabhrú leis nó léi an cás a chur i láthair
Barristers must act in accordance with the Bar Council Professional Code of Conduct
Caithfidh abhcóidí feidhmiú de réir Cód Proifisiúnta Iompair Chomhairle an Bharra
Barristers are subject to many general rules, such as:
Caitheann abhcóidí cuid mhaith rialacha ginearálta a leanúint, mar shampla:
• A barrister may only accept so much work as they can give adequate attention to within a reasonable time
• Ní féidir le abhcóide obair a ghlacadh thar an méid ar féidir leis a dhóthain airde a thabhairt air laistigh de achar réasúnta
• A barrister must ensure confidentiality concerning client matters
• Ní mór do abhcóide rúndacht a chinntiú maidir le hábhair cliant
• A barrister has duties towards the courts and they cannot mislead a court in any way
• Tá dualgais ag abhcóide ó thaobh na cúirte de agus ní féidir leis nó léi an chúirt a chur amú ar aon bhealach
• A barrister may not tout or advertise their services
• Ní féidir le abhcóide stocaireacht a dhéanamh ar chustaiméirí nó a chuid/a cuid seirbhísí a fhógairt
There are also more specific rules about the duties of barristers in criminal cases
Tá rialacha níos sainiúla ann faoi dhualgais abhcóidí i gcásanna coiriúla
Barristers' rates and fees vary greatly
Tá difríochtaí móra sna rátaí agus táillí a iarrann abhcóidí
You should ask your solicitor how much it will cost to engage a barrister to act on your behalf
Ba chóir ceist a chur ar do aturnae faoin gcostas a bheidh ar abhcóide a fhostú chun feidhmiú ar do shon
To engage a barrister, you must contact a solicitor who will then "brief" the barrister
Chun abhcóide a fhostú, ní mór duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le aturnae, agus cuirfidh sé sin mionteagasc chuig an abhcóide
